TopicTitle: Is Space engineers a good game?

Articles.Content: Is Space engineers a good game?And is it easy to get into?And is there any goals in the game?

http://blog.marekrosa.org/

i don't like the multiplayer pew pew pow pow boom boom aspect wich to me is a poor commercial choice in the said "game universe" aside that it's a very good concept and dev team.

i would have prefered to see something like fighting "space dinosaur" or "alien" than being that much "human player vs human player" oriented

but hey ; you know ; investor behind and tralalala exchange market ...

Edited July 27, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''

Somehow I've sunk nearly 500 hours into it, building improbably-large mining ships capable of eating massive chunks of asteroids.

It's alright.

A good couple of hours I've enjoyed myself with this game, even in single-player.

It gives me great fun starting from (almost) nothing to making big sprawling monstrosities!

Some things are keeping me from loving it 100%.

SE is very resource intensive. My computer is simply not up to the task of generating and sustaining medium to big environments, let alone, multi-player ones.

Also, the creators have the habit of feature-creep. Optimisations are rare.

Edited July 28, 2015 by T-Bouw
typo
Yea, it is pretty intensive. I can't play with asteroids but still massively enjoy the game.
The minimum graphics settings are just ridiculously high.

For now mostly watching for visual/aesthetics enhancement/"parts variety" vanilla (notice this is specific to SE and i don't apply the same reasoning for KSP, for wich i found cartoonistic approach better just missing a few more texture homogenisation) and planet implementation (// with medieval engi) before going back in.

(as the scenaristic scripting is on going since a few update wich is pretty cool 4 solo and multi related to SE)

Also mostly see SE in it's current form like a reduced and rough muddler of/for "star citizen" in some aspect and in term of potential long term ... time will tell

(and i expect it too be much more than that)

Edited July 27, 2015 by WinkAllKerb''

Yep. Space Engineers is an awesome game, 750+ hours on the record. Watch your system, though, my ultrabook (low TDP I7 + Intel HD 5500) went from 70 fps in empty world (high setting) to 4 fps when I finished my 300-block (600 m) battlecruiser (low setting + windowed 800x600).
I like it, but I've only got a few hours on it. It's quite resource-intensive as well, so be careful what you play it on.
